ai.summary: A challenging 15.3 km hike in the UK suitable for experienced walkers seeking a demanding day outdoors.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain is varied and uneven, with potential mud, grass paths, and sections of rocky or compacted surface. There may be gates or stiles and occasional short ascents and descents; footwear with good grip and ankle support is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a 15.3 km route: check weather and daylight hours; carry a map and a fully charged phone with offline access. Tell someone your planned route and estimated return time. Wear sturdy hiking boots and appropriate clothing; bring rain gear and extra layers. Stay hydrated and carry snacks; know your limits and turn back if conditions deteriorate. Be careful on uneven ground, stiles, and road crossings; watch for other hikers and pedestrians on narrow paths. In remote sections, consider carrying a small first aid kit and a whistle for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support and grip
Backpack with enough capacity for water, snacks, and extra layers
Water bottle or hydration system (at least 2–3 litres total for the day)
Map and compass (and a charged GPS device as backup)
Phone with offline maps and emergency contacts
High-energy snacks and a hydration plan
Lightweight rain gear and extra socks
Small first aid kit, whistle, and emergency blanket
Walking poles (optional but helpful on long, hard sections)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for longer daylight hours and milder conditions; winter hiking is more challenging and daylight is shorter.

seo.title: Mautby Women’s History Walk – 15.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan for the Mautby Women’s History Walk, a 15.3 km hard hike in the UK. Prepare your gear, check the terrain, and stay safe on varied routes.
